result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher Arnold Leitzinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristopher Arnold Leitzinger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristopher Arnold Leitzinger was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Kristopher Arnold Leitzinger was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay costs in the amount of $518.00

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Pursuant to Sec. 973.015, Wis. Stats., the record of the defendant may be expunged upon a successful completion of probation, and the court making a finding on the record that the person will benefit and society will not be harmed by this disposition.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall serve one years in Lafayette County Jail with Huber privileges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

Case called at 956 am 
D.A. Gill appears. 
Atty. Bucher appears with Def. appearing in person and in custody.
Atty. Bucher gives status; request amend bond to signature on Matters 2017CF101 and 2017CM104.
Court review DOC sentencing after revocation. 
Atty. Bucher request joint recommendation. 
State request joint recommendation with $380.00 Civil Judgement. 
Court grant recommendation of Count One-one year with Huber in Lafayette county jail; count three- 90 days in Lafayette county jail with Huber. 
Start date of 2/12/2018
71 days credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 12, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections

Case called 8:38 AM.  Defendant Kristopher Arnold Leitzinger in court with attorney Guy Taylor.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor informs the Court matter is resolved, Defendant shall change pleas from not guilty to guilty on counts 1 and 3, and  Count 2 shall be dismissed.  If probation is successful, expungement can be done under 973.015.  Attorney Taylor presents Plea and Waiver of Rights to the Court.  Court questions DE re: plea and waiver.  Parties stipulate factual basis found.  Attorney Taylor presents Plea Agreement to the Court.  Court questions DE re:  plea agreement.  Court questions Attorney Taylor re:  plea agreement.  State waives right to Jury Trial.  Court is satisfied DE enters plea knowingly, freely, voluntarily, and intelligently and finds him guilty on counts 1 and 3.  Attorney Taylor gives statement to the Court.  Court will follow plea agreement.  Court grants DE the right to file application for expungement if probation is successful.  DE makes statement to the Court regarding his future.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
